Regarding Highest Rated Articles

13 Apr 2001

Article with the same rating should be sorted by how many people have rated them. For example, the following is what I see right now on the sidebar under "Highest Rated Articles":\n
    \n
  • Some Caveats with Us�
    \n4.88 after 8 ratings
    • \n
  • Evolt.org offers fre�
    \n4.88 after 26 ratings
    • \n
  • The Tao of Testing
    \n4.88 after 8 ratings
    • \n
  • Flash Interface Usab�
    \n4.86 after 7 ratings
    • \n
  • Liquid Tables
    \n4.83 after 6 ratings
    • \n
\nThis should look like this:\n
    \n
  • Evolt.org offers fre�
    \n4.88 after 26 ratings
    • \n
  • Some Caveats with Us�
    \n4.88 after 8 ratings
    • \n
  • The Tao of Testing
    \n4.88 after 8 ratings
    • \n
  • Liquid Tables
    \n4.83 after 6 ratings
    • \n
\n
\nA high rating doesn't mean anything if only one person rated it (I am exagerating there, but you get the idea). It's not a big deal, but it would be more organized and makes more sense than the way it is now.
